snippet: A recent study recommended a variety of changes to the region’s convoluted network of transportation systems, but a uniform overhaul has been difficult to achieve.
abstract: Transportation policy experts in Bay Area are engaged in increasingly intense debate about region's patchwork public transportation system in which more than 20 operators are spread across 101 municipalities and nine counties; issues is of particular concern given higher housing costs in San Francisco, which have driven more people to move farther away from metropolitan hubs to find affordable housing.
lead_paragraph: A recent study recommended a variety of changes to the region’s convoluted network of transportation systems, but a uniform overhaul has been difficult to achieve.

headline.main: Bay Area’s Disjointed Public Transit Network Inspires a Call for Harmony
headline.print_headline: Bay Area’s Disjointed Public Transit Network Inspires a Call for Harmony
